Title.evidence: Title: Randomised Controlled Trial of First Pass Effect in Mechanical Thrombectomy: ASTER Trial

Trial_Design.evidence: The ASTER trial was a multicenter, randomized, open-label, blinded endpoint trial

Participants.evidence: Adults with anterior circulation ischemic stroke within 6 hours of onset

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates FPE rates and outcomes in the ASTER trial comparing stent retriever (SR) and contact aspiration (CA) techniques.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was favorable clinical outcome (mRS 0-2) at 90 days.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomization was stratified by intravenous thrombolysis use

Result_Outcome.evidence: FPE was achieved in 97 (28.9%), with no significant difference between SR (31.3%) and CA (26.3%) (adjusted RR 0.84, 95% CI 0.54 to 1.31; p=0.44).

Harms.evidence: FPE also resulted in fewer hemorrhagic transformations and procedural complications.
